Photo: Courtesy of Free People.

Spring may be months away, but that doesn’t mean we can’t start curating our warm-weather wardrobe — especially now that Free People dropped its latest campaign, which is a feminine, boho daydream come to life.

This new collection offers a fresh, modern take on the retailer’s signature look, featuring lace-trimmed and floral-print tees paired with utilitarian staples like barn jackets (still a thing!) and cargo-pocketed carpenter shorts. There's also a prep-school charm woven in via cardigans and polos, styled with loafers and knee-high socks, as well as perfectly slouchy denim and ’90s-inspired baby tees. Then, of course, there are vacation-ready pieces with an artisanal feel for those spring break escapes to somewhere sun-soaked.

With standout looks from in-house labels like We The Free and free-est, Free People’s spring collection nails every vibe worth pinning to your mood board. Take a closer look at the campaign and shop the six key trends for the season ahead.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

Casual Romance 

Sweet but not overly saccharine, these romantic styles are all about balancing feminine details with everyday ease. The lace-trimmed tanks and embroidered tees in so-soft fabrics are essentials for laid-back spring days.

Prep Classics

Prep-school polish gets a Free People twist — think cardigans and polos with more exaggerated fits and distinctive details (hello, eyelet collar), styled back to loafers and knee-high socks. It’s a nod to timeless collegiate charm, only with a fresh edge.

Big, Bold Denim 

The whispers of a skinny jeans resurgence won’t have us parting with baggy jeans just yet. Slouchy, oversized silhouettes still have our hearts, whether paired with baby tees or bikini tops.

Utility

From cargo-pocketed vests to barn jackets that add structure to breezy spring ‘fits, these staples blend practicality with low-key cool — perfect for grounding those floral-print, lace-trimmed tops.

Vacation Ready

These pieces are made for your next passport stamp. Featuring global-inspired prints and embroideries with an artisanal feel, these will be your spring break go-tos. Just add sun, SPF, and a woven tote.

‘90s Minimalism 

Channel your inner Gwyneth or Jen with ’90s-inspired staples like baby tees and lace-trimmed slip skirts. These pared-back pieces are the ultimate blank slate for creative spring styling.
